title: Images of Integration- explanation of response

content.description:
Source 1

Clinton, Tennessee, School Integration, 1956

The black-and-white photograph centers on 3 Black male students and 1 Black female student walking up a sidewalk.

1 of the Black male students and the Black female student carry books.

On both sides of the sidewalk stand several white male students, many of whom are watching the Black students.

A few white male students stand on the sidewalk itself.

Library of Congress

Source 2

New Orleans, Louisiana, School Integration, 1960

The black-and-white photograph centers on a small Black girl and two men in suits facing away from the camera.

The girl and the two men approach the door of William Frantz Public School.

In the foreground is an additional man in a suit sitting in a car observing the girl and the two men.

Underwood Archives / Getty Images

Ruby Bridges is escorted by US Marshals into William Frantz elementary school.
content.question: Which of the following best explains a response to the events depicted in the images?

content.answer: State governments often cut funding to integrated schools.
